headline: Silver Oak Securities Launched AFX Custom Models, Delivering Institutional-Quality Portfolios Constructed by Invesco,  Fidelity Investments, Aptus Capital and Other Industry-Leading Asset Managers
summary: JACKSON, Tenn., January 06, 2026--Silver Oak Securities today announced the launch of AFX Custom Models, available exclusively through its AdvisorFX platform.

headline: Bitcoin ETFs See Biggest Inflow in 3 Months as BlackRock Signals Crypto’s Structural Shift
summary: Bitcoin ETFs logged their biggest inflow in three months as BlackRock signals crypto’s shift from speculation to financial infrastructure.

headline: 3 Profitable Stocks We Keep Off Our Radar
summary: While profitability is essential, it doesn’t guarantee long-term success. Some companies that rest on their margins will lose ground as competition intensifies - as Jeff Bezos said, "Your margin is my opportunity".

raw.headline: 3 Profitable Stocks We Keep Off Our Radar
raw.summary: While profitability is essential, it doesn’t guarantee long-term success. Some companies that rest on their margins will lose ground as competition intensifies - as Jeff Bezos said, "Your margin is my opportunity".

headline: 3 Reasons to Sell IVZ and 1 Stock to Buy Instead
summary: What a fantastic six months it’s been for Invesco. Shares of the company have skyrocketed 69.7%, setting a new 52-week high of $28.37. This was partly due to its solid quarterly results, and the run-up might have investors contemplating their next move.

raw.headline: 3 Reasons to Sell IVZ and 1 Stock to Buy Instead

headline: How Investors May Respond To Invesco (IVZ) Capital Return Moves And Private-Markets Expansion
summary: In recent days, Invesco announced upcoming fourth-quarter 2025 results for January 27, 2026, alongside dividend declarations across its closed-end funds and a US$500 million preference share buyback at a premium, while also expanding a private-markets partnership with LGT Capital Partners. These moves collectively highlight Invesco’s focus on capital management and broadening access to private markets for U.S. investors, against a backdrop of routine fund distributions. We’ll now examine how...
